metadata.title: Shrimp Tapioca Masala Recipe
metadata.description:
Shrimp and tapioca cooked in coconut gravy. Delicious Kerala dish.
Recipe: http://www.thasneen.com/cooking/shrimp-tapioca-masala-shrimp-kappa-masala/
Connect with me via:
Fb: https://www.facebook.com/CookingwithThas/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/thasneen
Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/thasneen/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/cookingwiththas/

en: [00:00.000] Peel off the tapioca skin using a peeler and cut into rounds.
[00:10.000] Boil water in a large pot and season with salt.
[00:15.000] Add tapioca rounds and cook until tender but not mashed.
[00:25.000] Drain the water and set the cooked tapioca aside.
[00:30.000] In a blender, grind grated coconut, water, whole cinnamon, fennel powder, and turmeric powder into a smooth paste.
[00:45.000] Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat.
[00:50.000] Add sliced onions, season with salt, and sauté until translucent.
[01:00.000] Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for 3 minutes.
[01:10.000] Add curry leaves and chopped tomatoes, cook until tomatoes soften.
[01:20.000] Add chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and turmeric powder. Mix well and cook for 1 minute.
[01:30.000] Add shrimp, combine well, and cook covered for a few minutes until shrimp is cooked.
[01:45.000] If dry, add 1/4 cup water and cook covered.
[01:55.000] Add boiled tapioca to the shrimp masala and mix well.
[02:05.000] Pour in the ground coconut paste, season with salt, and combine thoroughly.
[02:15.000] Cook covered for a few minutes until raw coconut smell disappears.
[02:30.000] Stir and cook uncovered for 3 minutes if mixture is watery to thicken.
[02:40.000] Sprinkle chopped cilantro, cook for a few seconds, then remove from heat.
[02:45.000] Let the dish rest covered for a few minutes before serving warm.
